column2: MISSISSIPPI DMV TEST
column4: Mississippi
column6: MS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: A cold remedy.
column6: Marijuana.

column2: 2. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns to the right and then the left
column6: turns only to the left
column8: turns sharply to the left and then right

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Do not pass trucks
column6: Truck must back up

column2: 4. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column6: The driver on the right.

column2: 5. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: vehicle speed and distance are harder to judge.
column6: there are more cars on the roads at night.
column8: the speed limit is increased at night.

column2: 6. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.

column2: 7. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 8. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: The other answers are both correct.
column6: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
column8: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.

column2: 9. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: white; black
column6: green; white

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: 270 degree turn ahead.
column6: Roundabout ahead.

column2: 11. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column8: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.

column2: 12. Excessive speed:
column4: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.
column6: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.
column8: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.

column2: 13. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: what is not allowed.
column6: the direction they should travel.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: There is a detour ahead
column6: Crossroads ahead
column8: The highway ahead is being repaired

column2: 15. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column4: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column6: stay focused on the center line on the road.

column2: 16. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 17. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: a stop sign.
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 18. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 19. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 20. This is:
column4: a merging traffic sign.
column6: a side road sign.

column2: 21. Motorcycles:
column4: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column6: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: are easier to see than cars.

column2: 22. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.
column6: it draws the attention of other drivers.
column8: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.

column2: 23. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 24. Drinking alcohol:
column4: has no effect on either judgement or driving  ability.
column6: has no effect on driving ability but affects your judgement.
column8: harms both judgement and driving skills.

column2: 25. At intersections with a yield sign, you must:
column4: yield the right-of-way to cross traffic close enough to cause conflict.
column6: slow down and proceed.
column8: yield to the vehicles on your left only.

column2: 26. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 27. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: respect the posted speed limit.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 28. Braking distance is how far a vehicle travels:
column4: before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: while the driver is braking.

column2: 29. The use of alcohol and/or drugs affects:
column4: alertness and judgement.
column6: concentration and reaction time.

column2: 30. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
